Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Amulet
Description: Amulet depicting a seated ibis holding a feather in its open beak. It is sitting on a small rectangular pedestal. The details of the feather and the bird's tail are rendered with fine, small lines. The two surfaces of the amulet are identical. There is a suspension ring made of three elements on the bird's back. The object is carefully fashioned.
